qas.question: What language sub-family is Russian in?
Where is Russian an official language?

answers.text: Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan and many minor or unrecognised territories

context: Russian (ру́сский язы́к, russkiy yazyk, pronounced [ˈruskʲɪj jɪˈzɨk] ( listen)) is an <a0_0><b5_0>East Slavic<a0_0/> language<b5_0/> and an official language in <a1_0><b6_0>Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan<b6_0/> and many minor or unrecognised territories<a1_0/>. It is an unofficial but widely-spoken language in <a2_0>Ukraine, <b7_0>Latvia, Estonia<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and to a lesser extent, the other countries that were once constituent republics of the Soviet Union and former participants of the Eastern Bloc. Russian belongs to <b8_0>the family of Indo-European languages<b8_0/> and is one of the <a3_0>three<a3_0/> living members of the East Slavic languages. Written examples of Old East Slavonic are attested <b9_0>from the <a4_0>10th century<b9_0/><a4_0/> onwards.
